scenario_name: Semantic Confusion: Mercury, Rust, Java Cross-Context Chaos
conversation_title: Mercury, Rust, Java: Multi-Meaning Semantic Confusion
description: Tests LLM's ability to handle SEMANTIC CONFUSION with randomized context switches. Humans can easily identify which meaning is asked, but baseline LLMs mix contexts due to overlapping vocabulary and random jumping between topics. Questions use ambiguous phrasing that requires tracking conversation history.

conversations.message: I want to discuss three interesting topics: Mercury, Rust, and Java. They all have multiple meanings!
conversations.expected: Acknowledgment that Mercury (planet/element/god), Rust (corrosion/programming), Java (island/language/coffee) are ambiguous terms
conversations.linear_failure_risk: none - establishing baseline

conversations.message: Let's start with the one that orbits closest to our sun
conversations.expected: Mercury planet - smallest planet, closest to Sun, extreme temperatures, no atmosphere, heavily cratered
conversations.linear_failure_risk: low - clear reference to 'orbits sun' = planet

conversations.linear_failure_risk: low - 'JVM' clearly indicates programming language
